translations.translation: And Moses felt afraid within himself.
So Moses' heart was filled with fear.
And Moosa sensed fear in his heart.
So Musa conceived fear in himself.
So Musa conceived in his mind a fear.
and Moses conceived a fear within him.
And Moses conceived a fear in his mind.
and in his heart Moses became apprehensive,
Then a kind of fear in his soul Musa felt.
Then Moses felt a fear within his heart.
So Moses conceived in his mind a (sort of) fear.
So Musa (Moses) conceived a fear in himself.
So Moses felt apprehensive within himself.
And he sensed within himself apprehension, did Moses.

[20:67] And Moses sensed fear within himself, that is to say, he feared that if [the effect of] their sorcery was of the same kind as his miracle, he would become suspect in people’s minds and they would not believe in him.
(And Moses conceived a fear in his mind) Moses concealed his fear of them. He was afraid that they would kill all those who believed in him, if he failed to defeat them.

commentaries.author: زيد بن علي
commentaries.text: وقوله تعالى: { فَأَوْجَسَ فِي نَفْسِهِ خِيفَةً مُّوسَىٰ } يعني أَضمرَ خَوفاً

commentaries.author: ابن عجيبة
commentaries.text:
{ فَأَوْجَسَ فِي نَفْسِهِ خِيفَةً } أي: خوفًا، { موسى }: أي: أضمر في نفسه بعض خوف، من جهة الطبع البشري المجبول على النفرة من الحيات، والاحتراز من ضررها
 وقال مقاتل: إنما خاف موسى، إذ صنع القوم مثل صنيعه، بأن يشكُّوا فيه، فلا يتبعوه، ويشك فيه من تابعه
